info.game_comments:
2008-B Teen Tournament quarterfinal game 1.

Ask Alex #1: Will Ferrell.

(1, 1).clue: "I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed"

(2, 1).clue: "I was elected in 2003 & I am sure I can bench press more than all the other governors combined"

(3, 1).clue: Ann Richards lost her job as governor to this part-owner of the Texas Rangers

(4, 1).clue: The red-bellied type is the sharpest-toothed of this fish whose jaws Amazon Indians have used as scissors

(5, 1).clue: If you're into vegan shoes, you'll go hyperdrive for the designs of this Padme portrayer

(6, 1).clue: Baby seat with a feeding tray

(1, 2).clue: A "savage journey" titled "Fear & Loathing in Las Vegas"

(2, 2).clue: "I started life as Anakin Skywalker & yes, Luke, I am your father!"

(3, 2).clue: The term "Reagan Democrats" came into pundit parlance after his loss in the 1980 presidential election

(4, 2).clue: This domesticated pack animal is the largest member of the camel family in South America

(5, 2).clue: You don't have to be of legal drinking age to shop at this store that sells the Heritage 1981 brand

(6, 2).clue: Sneakers that lace up to the ankle

(1, 3).clue: "Le Comte de Monte Cristo", un roman passionant

(2, 3).clue: "Dudes!  So, as Neo, if I die in 'The Matrix', I die in real life?"

(3, 3).clue: Like his son, he served only one term as U.S. president

(4, 3).clue: This fastest land mammal can reach 45 mph in 2 seconds flat; go cat, go!

(5, 3).clue: Buy your next pair of insane kicks from a faux referee at this store started by Woolworth's

(6, 3).clue: It's the sporting event you're competing in if you perform a Fosbury flop

(2, 4).clue: "Yeah, baby!  Mike Myers has played me, a British spy, in 3 shagadelic movies"

(3, 4).clue: This president flushed himself from office after "Plumbers" broke open a torrent at Watergate

(4, 4).clue: In Europe, the moose goes by this 3-letter name

(5, 4).clue: If you want to go cas, fly to this store whose name means "air mail" in French

(6, 4).clue: Avast!  Our vessel has been left aground in this 3-word condition

(1, 5).clue: A poem called "The Lady of Shalott"

(2, 5).clue: "That's right, Minnie, my first animated talkie was 1928's 'Steamboat Willie'"

(3, 5).clue: Herbert Hoover went into a great depression when he lost to this man in 1932

(4, 5).clue: Pictured here, this husky-like sled dog is named for the Inuit tribe who developed the breed

(5, 5).clue: Hello Kitty is the star character & corporate symbol of this gift store

(6, 5).clue: On meeting Prince Charles, first address him with this 3-word phrase

(1, 1).clue: In area, it's the largest country that borders Colombia

(3, 1).clue: A military academy was founded at this site on March 16, 1802

(4, 1).clue: This "Pirates of the Caribbean" sequel was the year's bestselling DVD

(5, 1).clue: This city's Cable Car Museum has one from fhe first company, the Clay Street Hill Railroad

(6, 1).clue: Nickname for a native of Indiana

(1, 2).clue: One can sail out of the port of Cartagena into this sea

(3, 2).clue: Edward Doherty commanded the cavalry unit that captured this assassin in 1865

(4, 2).clue: The No. 1 video game was this former coach's "NFL '07"

(5, 2).clue: This museum at the Smithsonian originated with a group of kites obtained from the Chinese Imperial Commission in 1876

(6, 2).clue: Traditionally, it was red & found at the end of a freight train

(1, 3).clue: With the help of the U.S., this country gained its independence from Colombia in 1903

(3, 3).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew points to a map of the American Northwest on the monitor.)  From the hoped-for northern boundary of the Oregon territory, which was later set at the 49th parallel, came the rallying cry of Democrats in 1844: this "or fight!"

(4, 3).clue: This national newspaper based in McLean, Virginia led all others in daily circulation with almost 2.3 million

(5, 3).clue: Janis Joplin's 1965 Porsche is one of the artifacts at this Cleveland museum
(5, 3).correct response: the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame

(6, 3).clue: It's the military item seen here--trust me, it doesn't have a funny comic inside

(1, 4).clue: Its name means "peaceful" & it's home to El Nino

(3, 4).clue: (Jon of the Clue Crew shows a map.)  Oklahoma has a panhandle because Texas couldn't have land north of 36°30' north or it would have had to free its slaves under this 1820 deal

(4, 4).clue: This Dan Brown book was 2006's top-selling trade paperback

(5, 4).clue: The Nelson Mandela National Museum comprises 3 sites in & around Qunu in this country

(6, 4).clue: A sharp, often virulent satire, perhaps a "National" one

(1, 5).clue: In 2000 the pres. of this country wanted to replace its sucre with our dollar--he got deposed, but it happened

(3, 5).clue: This abolitionist began publishing The Liberator, his anti-slavery newspaper, in 1831

(4, 5).clue: 2006's top-selling PC software was for easing the preparation of these, an annual April headache

(5, 5).clue: In 1785 architect Juan de Villanueva was commissioned to design this Madrid museum

(6, 5).clue: To deceive or cheat, possibly at this variety of pool

(0, 0).clue: When this was explained to Chief Sho-kup, he gave it a Shoshone name that means "wire rope express"
